id_table_2.caption: Comparison with leading methods on image-based visual language benchmarks. Our performance is close to leading VLMs, surpassing many methods by a large margin under the same LLM size, even with a discrete visual token type. * indicates that images in the training split of these datasets are observed during VLM training.

id_table_4.caption: Comparison with other visual generation methods on GenAI-Bench GenAI-Bench . The results show that our method outperforms previous autoregressive visual generation methods. For advanced prompts that require better text following ability to generate, our method can have a relatively small performance gap with diffusion-based methods, even with much less training data and time.Figure 3: VILA-U can correctly caption videos and cover all the details, thanks to the text alignment of our vision encoder.Figure 4: VILA-U has good visual question answering capability. The images and questions are from the test split of VQAv2 dataset.Figure 5: VILA-U has good in-context learning capability. We feed two image-text pairs and a third image as the context to prompt the VLM.Figure 6: VILA-U can correctly reason over multiple images.Figure 7: VILA-U can generate high-quality images and videos given text input.Table 6: Impact of contrastive loss to visual understanding.Table 7: Impact of contrastive loss to visual generation.Table 8: Impact of CFG.
